Detailed Description

The implementation of a pthread-specialized thread.

This class provides the wrapper for a pthread_t.

Definition at line 154 of file ThreadInterface.h.

thread_t & sys::ThreadInterface< thread_t >::getNative (  )  [inline, inherited]

Returns the native type. You probably should not use this unless you have specific constraints on which package you use Use of this function may defeat the purpose of these classes: to provide thread implementation in an abstract interface.

Definition at line 258 of file ThreadInterface.h.

virtual void sys::ThreadInterface< thread_t >::run (  )  [inline, virtual, inherited]

The only function that is specialized by the implementor This function is called by start if no target is defined, allowing the implementor to inherit this class directly

Implements sys::Runnable.

Definition at line 163 of file ThreadInterface.h.

virtual void sys::ThreadInterface< thread_t >::setPriority ( int  priority  )  [inline, virtual, inherited]

Set the thread priority. The meaning of this function depends upon the implementing thread packages. Please consult the notes individually for interpretations of the behavior. Setting the priority may take effect immediately, or it may not. Either way, the behavior should be graceful so as not to disturb the functionality of the actual thread.

Parameters:
priority The new priority
